GIS.geometry

Class GISPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.geometry.Geometry
      • GIS.geometry.GISPolyline
        • GIS.geometry.GISPolygon

  • public class GISPolygon
extends GISPolyline
    Polygon class, inherits from Polyline. A Polygon is just a closed Polyline. When finished drawing, the first point from the Polyline will be added as last point to close the Polygon (method: closePolygon) Refer to the object Polyline for the inherited methods to fill the pointlist and write to or create from DB/CSV friendly formats. Additional attributes for Polylines are: circumference and area.
    Author:
    Lukas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GISPolygon()
      Constructor: because GISPolygon extends from GISPolyline and not from Geometry, the type field of the super.super class can not be acessed (not allowed); The attribute needs to be changed indirectly by calling the setTypeToPolygon() method of the class GISPolyline

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods
